metadata.Title: CVE-2021-33655 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.Description:
When sending malicous data to kernel by ioctl cmdFBIOPUT_VSCREENINFO,kernel will write memory out of bounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33655` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-5.4.0-126-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-generic - 5.4.0-126.142
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-126-lowlatency - 5.4.0-126.142
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1075-kvm - 5.4.0-1075.80
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-126.142').
